RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 57. Maiden Special Weight Purse 26500. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 120 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: YOU CAN'T WIN rated the pace inside, was given rein nearing the three eighths pole, widened at the rail on the far turn and extended her lead under steady stretch handling. SHOCKING FACTS ducked in leaving the gate then settled off the rail on the first turn, bid leaving the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail and was no match in the lane. DEE DEE SIX veered outward leaving the gate then saved ground on the first turn, picked up the chase from the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and showed little more. A LOTTA MOXIE stalked two deep into the first turn, gave chase from the three eighths pole but drifted through the far turn, raced wide into the lane and flattened stride. NOW I'M HERE stalked the early pace then settled close on the first turn, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn in the four and five paths and showed little in the lane. HONEY PLEASE was shuffled back at the break then settled off the rail on the opening turn, eased out into the backstretch, gave chase toward the three eighths pole, raced in the six path entering the far turn but angled to the inside toward the eighth pole and showed little more.

ENTRY.NAME: You Can't Win
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,given rein 3/8,widened rail turn,steady urging

ENTRY.NAME: Now I'm Here
ENTRY.OWNER: Brooks Gerald E and Hess Jr Carl L

ENTRY.NAME: Dee Dee Six
ENTRY.COMMENT: veered out break,saved ground,chased 3/8,rail far turn,empty lane

ENTRY.NAME: Shocking Facts
ENTRY.OWNER: Brooks Gerald E and Hess Jr Carl L
ENTRY.COMMENT: ducked in break,off rail 1st turn,bid 3/8,no match

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 7F Dirt CR: 89. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 24000. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $15,000. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-win ners Of A Race Since September 18 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since August 18 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000 (Races Where Entered For $10,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MISSIONSNINETYNINE raced with the early pace then stalked two deep on the first turn, took the nod toward the seven sixteenths pole and contested the edge two deep on the far turn, dug in under determined handling and inched clear later yards. AUBURN MILL became a bit anxious in the gate and raced with the early pace inside, was met toward the seven sixteenths pole and dueled at mostly even terms from that point, contested at a close disadvantage nearest the rail on the far turn and dueled gamely to deep stretch before relenting. GOLDEN APPEAL was forced out leaving the gate then settled off the rail on the opening turn, bid nearing the three eighths pole, raced in the four path on the far turn and came along for third the final strides. OUT OF CENTS stalked from the two and three paths the first turn, gave chase past the seven sixteenths pole, raced close three wide on the far turn then flattened inside the sixteenth pole. SHAMELESS RISK veered out leaving the gate then rated close inside, picked up the chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and showed little further.

ENTRY.NAME: Shameless Risk
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W
ENTRY.COMMENT: veered out break,rated close,chased 3/8,rail turn,empty lane

ENTRY.NAME: Golden Appeal
ENTRY.COMMENT: forced out break,off rail,bid 3/8,4p far turn,along 3rd late

ENTRY.NAME: Auburn Mill
ENTRY.COMMENT: anxious in gate,w/pace inside,met 7/16,dueled,game to late lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 61. Maiden Claiming Purse 16600. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 121 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $10,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: THE MONEY MACHINE ducked in leaving the gate then took over and rated the pace inside, came under pressure leaving the seven sixteenths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and was steadily handled to hold on. PLANET FROLIC was forced in leaving the gate then settled close inside, steadied near the rail into the far turn, eased out with a bid approaching the head of the lane and finished well at the outside withers of the winner. MISSING A SOCK stalked four wide on the first turn, picked up the chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the four path then flattened later yards. DASHING LASS became edgy in the gate then stalked from the three path the first turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced in the three path on the far turn then flattened stride inside the sixteenth pole. EMBRACEABLE was forced inward leaving the gate then settled off the rial on the first turn, gave chase past the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn in the three and four paths and flattened in the stretch. IMAGINE RITA rounded the first turn in the four path, picked up the chase nearing the three eighths pole, entered the far turn about the six path, angled back to the four path toward the top of the stretch but showed little more. NO SHARING raced in the four and five paths the first turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole but flattened in the five path on the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Planet Frolic
ENTRY.COMMENT: forced in break,settled inside,steadied rail 1/4,strong finish

ENTRY.NAME: Embraceable
ENTRY.COMMENT: forced in break,off rail,chased 7/16,3& 4p far turn,flattened

ENTRY.NAME: The Money Machine
ENTRY.COMMENT: quick lead,rated pace inside,pressured 7/16,rail turn,held on

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 7F Dirt CR: 75. Claiming Purse 16600. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Three Races Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000, For Each $1,000 To $8,000 1 lb. (Races Where Entered For $6,250 Or Less Not Consi dered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FROG TOWN rated close toward the inside, started a bid approaching the three eighths pole and drew to even terms three wide toward the head of the lane, took the lead nearing mid-stretch and drew clear under steady handling. NO ME DIGAS settled off the rail on the opening turn, picked up the chase and closed to the heels of Bali's Shade approaching the head of the lane, angled to the four path leaving the far turn and dug in to take second later yards. GAMMA SQUEEZE took the lead passing the thirteen sixteenths pole and moved to the inside to set the pace, dug in to the challenge of Bali's Shade nearing the three eighths pole and dueled at near even terms from that point, contested the edge at the rail on the far turn but was caught while flattening stride approaching mid-stretch. AKINGISALWAYSKING rounded the first turn about the four path, picked up the chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn in the three path and ran evenly in the stretch. BALI'S SHADE tapered in and stalked off the rail, challenged toward the three eighths pole and dueled at near even terms two deep on the far turn, but flattened stride leaving the eighth pole. STRONG HEART rounded the opening turn in the three path, picked up the chase toward the three eighths pole but showed little response.

ENTRY.NAME: Gamma Squeeze
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,dueled from 3/8,met into lane,caught 1/16,flatn

ENTRY.NAME: Bali's Shade
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked off rail,challenged 3/8,dueled,2d far turn,flattened lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 68. Claiming Purse 15700. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000, For Each $1,000 To $8,000 1 lb. (W V A Races Not Considered In Eli gibility)(Races Where Entered For $6,250 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BEST VIRGINIA saved ground off the pace on the first turn, gave chase leaving the half mile pole and angled to the five path on the far turn, dug in widest leaving the turn and got up the final yards. SUPERSNAKE rated close two deep on the first turn, challenged at even terms from the three eighths pole and contested the edge two deep on the far turn, was met leaving the turn but dug in gamely to earn the nod for second, while outfinished for the win. WINDSOR'S PLAY rated a slim lead inside, came under pressure and dueled at even terms leaving the three eighths pole, contested at a close disadvantage nearest the rail on the far turn, briefly recovered the advantage entering the stretch but was caught in later yards then nipped from second. LET'S GO MO saved ground on the first turn, gave chase past the seven sixteenths pole and rounded the far turn near the rail and finished well. HERETODAYGONMANANA raced two deep on the first turn, picked up the chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole and rounded the far turn about the three path, was gaining well through the stretch but was shuffled back in the closing strides. MAY MAYS CASTLE rounded the first turn in the three path, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole and raced close three wide on the far turn, but flattened stride inside the eighth pole. BAYS CASTLE raced two deep on the first turn and showed little response through the backstretch. SUPERSTASIA stalked three wide early on then faded past the three eighths pole.

ENTRY.NAME: Best Virginia
ENTRY.OWNER: O'Sullivan Farms LLC and Conrad Randall R
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,chased 1/2,angled 5 turn,dug in widest,up late

ENTRY.NAME: Windsor's Play
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated slim lead,dueled from 3/8,rail turn,caught late,nipped 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Let's Go Mo
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,chased 7/16,rail far turn,finished well inside

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 7F Dirt CR: 84. Allowance Purse 27400. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since August 18 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Conside red In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SUMMERTIME ROSE veered outward and made contact with Boundtobeck leaving the gate then stalked from the three path, challenged toward the five sixteenths pole, raced close two deep on the far turn, dug in for the lead mid-stretch and edged clear later yards. BACHELORETTE stalked two deep then took the lead nearing the half mile pole, came under pressure approaching the three eighths, contested the edge at the rail on the far turn, dug in under steady handling but was caught mid-stretch and relented later yards. XANTHE saved ground, bid nearing the three eighths pole, raced in the three path on the far turn and ran evenly in the lane. GOOD ACCELEBRATE saved ground, bid nearing the five sixteenths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and ran evenly to mid-stretch before flattening stride. SOMEBODY LOVES ME veered out leaving the gate then saved ground, picked up the chase approaching the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail, eased out leaving the turn and showed little more. BOUNDTOBEOK bobbled and was bumped leaving the gate then moved to the inside and showed the way early on, was met into the backstretch, gave chase at that point but faded at the rail on the far turn. TRAVEL SMART raced off the rail on the first turn, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole but weakened in the four path on the far turn. This race was hand timed.

ENTRY.NAME: Somebody Loves Me
ENTRY.COMMENT: veered out break,saved ground,chased 3/8,off rail turn,empty lane

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Adrian Regan, John Wade & Pat Barrett

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 73. Allowance Purse 27400. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since September 18 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since August 18 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CIDERHOUSE WAY raced with the pace through the front stretch then stalked from the nine sixteenths pole, challenged toward the three eighths, took the nod approaching the five sixteenth, drew clear into the far turn and was steadily handled through the stretch. VAGABOND VIRGIN saved ground close to the pace, gave chase toward the five sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn in the three path and had to settle for second. KAYLEE'S SPITFIRE settled off the rail on the first turn, picked up the chase toward the three eighths pole, raced in the three path on the far turn then dueled through the stretch for third. O'RIGSBY lunged from the gate and settled well back saving early ground, bid approaching the five sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail and was outfinished in the stretch duel for third. SCARE DEM raced well off the pace two deep on the first turn, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn in the three path and showed little in the lane. MY BUDDY DUANE closed to the lead two deep approaching the nine sixteenths pole, came under pressure nearing the three eighths and was met toward the five sixteenths, dropped back into the far turn and faded at the rail. SUGAR LIPS rounded the opening turn in the three path, picked up the chase toward the seven sixteenths pole but weakened past the five sixteenths.

ENTRY.NAME: Scare Dem
ENTRY.COMMENT: well off pace 2d,chased 7/16,3p far turn,little in lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 82. Claiming Purse 13700. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE APRIL 18, 2023 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Since April 18 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, al lowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: RAISE A SPEIGHTS rated a short lead inside, was met past the half mile pole and dueled at mostly even terms through the backstretch, drew clear approaching the quarter pole, drifted leaving the turn but dug in when straightened away and widened later yards. ELVIRUS stalked inside, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, closed at the rail on the far turn but flattened stride late yards. SULEMAN rounded the opening turn about the four path, picked up the chase from the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn in the six path and ran evenly in the lane. BLAMEITONTHEFUN stalked off the rail, challenged at even terms past the half mile pole and dueled at even terms, but dropped back toward the quarter and weakened on the far turn. ROYAL THUNDER rounded the opening turn in the four path then stalked into the backstretch, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced in the five path on the far turn and weakened in the lane. SMALL REASON raced off the rail on the first turn, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole but flattened off the rail on the far turn. A HUGE CHECKPOINT raced in the five path the first turn then faded through the backstretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Elvirus
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked inside,chased 3/8,closed rail far turn,flattened late
